content:
Karl Stolley said:

One general thing about keyboard navigation as currently implemented is that it's highly oriented around unread messages. It takes a fair amount of work to get to a specific topic or stream without unreads using just the keyboard.

100%. The n key is somewhat insidious in that it makes it so that most people can kinda survive with just the keyboard, but what we really need is natural arrow-based and tab-based navigation.
(where "we" is keyboard users, whether by preference or necessity)
...and I'm now adding that to my list of reasons that Tab focus ought to follow the active-message box around.

Karl Stolley said:

...and I'm now adding that to my list of reasons that Tab focus ought to follow the active-message box around.

Now you're just preaching to the choir. :smile:

The Zulip app is a tic-tac-toe layout. Nine squares (albeit of unequal sizes). The only challenge to natural navigation is moving sideways.

Icon | Search | Gear
DM | Message Pane | Buddy list
Streams | Compose box | Keyboard icon

There is surely a navigation paradigm that would work for Zulip that didn't require memorizing a bunch of hotkeys. Maybe you'd need about three to get the cursor in the right spot, but then you should be able to navigate the app like you're on an Apple IIe or TI-99/4a
8 messages were moved here from #design > recent conversations for streams by Evy.
